sen.j: 三浦 環（みうら たまき、1884年（明治17年）2月22日 東京府 - 1946年（昭和21年）5月26日）は、おそらく日本で初めて国際的な名声をつかんだオペラ歌手。
sen.e: Tamaki MIURA (三浦 環, February 22, 1884 in Tokyo-fu [Tokyo Prefecture] - May 26, 1946) was an opera singer who was probably the first to gain the international reputation in Japan.
Tamaki MIURA (February 22, 1884 in Tokyo-fu [Tokyo Prefecture] - May 26, 1946) was an opera singer who was probably the first to gain the international reputation in Japan.
sen.cmt: 漢字名を削除しました。
sen.e: Tamaki MIURA (February 22, 1884 in Tokyo-fu [Tokyo Prefecture] - May 26, 1946) was an opera singer who was probably the first to gain the international reputation in Japan.

sen.j: 十八番であった、ジャコモ・プッチーニの『蝶々夫人』の「蝶々さん」と重ね合わされて、国際的に有名だった。
sen.e: She was famous internationally because she was identified with 'Cio-Cio-San' (蝶々さん) in Giacomo Puccini's "Madama Butterfly" (蝶々夫人) which was her favorite and forte.
She was famous internationally because she was identified with 'Cho-Cho-San' (蝶々さん) in Giacomo Puccini's "Madama Butterfly" (蝶々夫人) which was her favorite and forte.
She was famous internationally because she was identified with 'Cho-Cho-San' (蝶々さん) in Giacomo Puccini's "Madama Butterfly" (蝶々夫人) which was her favorite and forte.

sen.j: 元の名は柴田環（しばた たまき）、次いで藤井環（ふじい たまき）といった。
sen.e: Her original name was Tamaki SHIBATA, and then Tamaki FUJII.
Her original name was Tamaki SHIBATA, and then Tamaki FUJII.
Her original name was Tamaki SHIBATA, and then Tamaki FUJII.

sen.j: 芝 (東京都港区)で、公証人の柴田猛甫を父に、永田登波を母に生まれる。
sen.e: She was born to a notary public Takeho SHIBATA as her father and Toha NAGATA as her mother at Shiba (Minato Ward, Tokyo).
sen.cmt: Web原稿の本文テキストには「(東京都港区)」という語句は記載されていません（リンクのヒントに含まれている語句です）。「柴田猛甫」と「永田登波」の正式な読みは未確認です。
sen.e: She was born to a notary public Takeho SHIBATA as her father and Toha NAGATA as her mother at Shiba (Minato Ward, Tokyo).
She was born to a notary public Takeho SHIBATA as her father and Toha NAGATA as her mother at Shiba (Minato Ward, Tokyo).

sen.j: 1900年に東京音楽学校に進み、ピアノを滝廉太郎に師事。
sen.e: In 1900, she entered Tokyo Music School, and studied the piano under Rentaro TAKI.
In 1900, she entered Tokyo Music School, and studied the piano under Rentaro TAKI.
In 1900, she entered Tokyo Music School, and studied the piano under Rentaro TAKI.

sen.j: 1903年に日本人による最初のオペラ上演に出演する（『オルフェオとエウリディーチェ』のエウリディーチェ役）。
sen.e: In1903, she appeared in the first opera performance in Japan (she played the role of Euridice in "Orfeo ed Euridice").
In1903, she appeared in the first opera performance in Japan (she played the role of Euridice in "Orfeo ed Euridice.")
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変更しました。
sen.e: In1903, she appeared in the first opera performance in Japan (she played the role of Euridice in "Orfeo ed Euridice.")

sen.j: 1904年に卒業後、補助教員として東京音楽学校に勤務。
sen.e: In 1904, after graduation, she worked as a supporting teacher in Tokyo Music School.
In 1904, after graduation, she worked as a supporting teacher in Tokyo Music School.
In 1904, after graduation, she worked as a supporting teacher in Tokyo Music School.

sen.j: その後、助教授となる。
sen.e: Then she became an assistant professor.
Then she became an assistant professor.
Then she became an assistant professor.

sen.j: この間に山田耕筰らを指導したと言われる。
sen.e: It is said that she instructed Kosaku YAMADA and others during this term.
It is said that she instructed Kosaku YAMADA and others during this term.
It is said that she instructed Kosaku YAMADA and others during this term.

sen.j: 1911年に帝国劇場に所属し、翌年よりプリマドンナとして活躍を続ける。
sen.e: In 1911, she became a member of the Teikoku-gekijo Theater, and from the next year she went on being active as the prima donna.
In 1911, she became a member of the Teikoku-gekijo Theater (the Imperial Garden Theater), and from the next year she went on being active as the prima donna.
sen.cmt: 帝国劇場の英訳を補足しました。
sen.e: In 1911, she became a member of the Teikoku-gekijo Theater (the Imperial Garden Theater), and from the next year she went on being active as the prima donna.

sen.j: 1913年に柴田家の養子で医師の三浦政太郎と結婚した後、夫とともに1914年にドイツに留学する。
sen.e: In 1913, she got married to Seitaro MIURA who had been adopted into the Shibata family and was a doctor, and then, she and her husband went to Germany to study in 1914.
sen.cmt: 「三浦政太郎」の正式な読みは未確認です。
sen.e: In 1913, she got married to Seitaro MIURA who had been adopted into the Shibata family and was a doctor, and then, she and her husband went to Germany to study in 1914.
In 1913, she got married to Seitaro MIURA who had been adopted into the Shibata family and was a doctor, and then, she and her husband went to Germany to study in 1914.

sen.j: しかし第一次世界大戦の戦火を逃れてイギリスに移動。
sen.e: But to escape from the fires of World War I, she moved to England.
But to escape from the fires of World War I, she moved to England.
But to escape from the fires of World War I, she moved to England.

sen.j: 1915年の英国デビューの成功を受けて1916年に渡米し、ボストンで初めて蝶々さんを演じる。
sen.e: As a result of the success of her debut in England in 1915, she moved to America in 1916, and she performed the role of Cio-Cio-San in Boston for the first time.
As a result of the success of her debut in England in 1915, she moved to America in 1916, and she performed the role of Cho-Cho-San in Boston for the first time.
As a result of the success of her debut in England in 1915, she moved to America in 1916, and she performed the role of Cho-Cho-San in Boston for the first time.

sen.j: 好意的な批評によって、その後『蝶々夫人』やピエトロ・マスカーニの『イリス (オペラ)』をニューヨークやサンフランシスコ、シカゴで演ずることができた（三浦環はメトロポリタン歌劇場に迎えられた最初の日本人歌手である）。
sen.e: Thanks to the favorable criticisms, she was subsequently able to perform "Madama Butterfly" and "Iris" (an opera) composed by Pietro Mascagni in New York, San Francisco, and Chicago (Tamaki MIURA was the first Japanese singer that was received to the Metropolitan Opera House.)

Thanks to the favorable criticisms, she was subsequently able to perform "Madama Butterfly" and "Iris" (an opera) composed by Pietro Mascagni in New York, San Francisco, and Chicago (Tamaki MIURA was the first Japanese singer that was received to the Metropolitan Opera House.)

Thanks to the favorable criticisms, she was subsequently able to perform "Madama Butterfly" and "Iris" (an opera) composed by Pietro Mascagni in New York, San Francisco, and Chicago (Tamaki MIURA was the first Japanese singer that was received to the Metropolitan Opera House.)

sen.j: その後ヨーロッパに戻りロンドンでトマス・ビーチャム歌劇団と共演した。
sen.e: Then she returned to Europe, and performed with the Thomas Beecham Opera Company in London
Then she returned to Europe, and performed with the Thomas Beecham Opera Company in London
Then she returned to Europe, and performed with the Thomas Beecham Opera Company in London

sen.j: 1918年にアメリカ合衆国に戻り、『蝶々夫人』とアンドレ・メサジェの『お菊さん』を上演するが、後者は「蝶々さん」の焼き直しに過ぎないとして不評であった。
sen.e: In 1918, she went back to the United States of America, and performed "Madama Butterfly" and "Madame Chrysantheme" (お菊さん) composed by Andre Messager, but the latter got a bad reputation because it was considered as only a rehash of 'Cio-Cio-San'.

In 1918, she went back to the United States of America, and performed "Madama Butterfly" and "Madame Chrysantheme" (お菊さん) composed by Andre Messager, but the latter got a bad reputation because it was considered as only a rehash of 'Cho-Cho-San'.

In 1918, she went back to the United States of America, and performed "Madama Butterfly" and "Madame Chrysantheme" (お菊さん) composed by Andre Messager, but the latter got a bad reputation because it was considered as only a rehash of 'Cho-Cho-San'.

sen.j: 1920年にモンテカルロ、バルセロナ、フィレンツェ、ローマ、ミラノ、ナポリの歌劇場に客演する。
sen.e: In 1920, she made a guest appearance at the opera houses in Monte Carlo, Barcelona, Florence, Rome, Milan, and Naples.
In 1920, she made a guest appearance at the opera houses in Monte Carlo, Barcelona, Florence, Rome, Milan, and Naples.
In 1920, she made a guest appearance at the opera houses in Monte Carlo, Barcelona, Florence, Rome, Milan, and Naples.

sen.j: 1922年に帰国すると長崎市に留まり、『蝶々夫人』とゆかりの土地を訪ね歩き、演奏会を開いた。
sen.e: In 1922, after she came back to Japan, she stayed in Nagasaki City and walked around to visit the places associated with "Madama Butterfly", and gave concerts.
In 1922, after she came back to Japan, she stayed in Nagasaki City and walked around to visit the places associated with "Madama Butterfly", and gave concerts.
In 1922, after she came back to Japan, she stayed in Nagasaki City and walked around to visit the places associated with "Madama Butterfly", and gave concerts.

sen.j: 三浦環が蝶々さんに扮した姿の銅像は、プッチーニの銅像とともに長崎市のグラバー園に建っている。
sen.e: The bronze statue representing the figure of Tamaki MIURA playing the role of Cio-Cio-San is erected along with the bronze statue of Puccini in the Glover Garden in Nagasaki City.
The bronze statue representing the figure of Tamaki MIURA playing the role of Cho-Cho-San is erected along with the bronze statue of Puccini in the Glover Garden in Nagasaki City.
The bronze statue representing the figure of Tamaki MIURA playing the role of Cho-Cho-San is erected along with the bronze statue of Puccini in the Glover Garden in Nagasaki City.

sen.j: 1924年に再び渡米し、サン・カルロ・オペラ団に出演する。
sen.e: In 1924, she went to America again, and appeared with San Carlo Opera Company.
sen.cmt: 「サン・カルロ・オペラ団」の正式な英語表記は未確認です。
sen.e: In 1924, she went to America again, and appeared with San Carlo Opera Company.
In 1924, she went to America again, and appeared with San Carlo Opera Company.

sen.j: 1925年にシカゴに行き、アルド・フランケッティから献呈された『浪子さん』を初演する。
sen.e: In 1925, she went to Chicago and gave the first performance of "Namiko-san" (浪子さん) presented by Aldo Franchetti.
sen.cmt: 「アルド・フランケッティ」、「『浪子さん』」の正式な英語表記は未確認です。
sen.e: In 1925, she went to Chicago and gave the first performance of "Namiko-san" (浪子さん) presented by Aldo Franchetti.
In 1925, she went to Chicago and gave the first performance of "Namiko-san" (浪子さん) presented by Aldo Franchetti.

sen.j: その後はイタリアで歌手活動を続け、1935年にはパレルモで『蝶々夫人』出演2000回の記録を達成した。
sen.e: After that, she continued to make activities as a singer in Italy, and in 1935, she achieved the record of 2000 appearances in "Madama Butterfly" in Palermo.
After that, she continued to make activities as a singer in Italy, and in 1935, she achieved the record of 2000 appearances in "Madama Butterfly" in Palermo.
After that, she continued to make activities as a singer in Italy, and in 1935, she achieved the record of 2000 appearances in "Madama Butterfly" in Palermo.

sen.j: 1936年についに帰国し、歌舞伎座で『蝶々夫人』の上演に取り組んだが、やがて第二次世界大戦の勃発により音楽活動を禁じられると、山中湖に母親を連れて移住し、その地で戦火を逃れて静かな余生を送った。
sen.e: In 1936, she came back to Japan at last, and she was engaged in performing "Madama Butterfly" at Kabuki-za Theater, but after the musical activities were banned because World War II broke out soon, she moved with her mother to the neighborhood of Lake Yamanaka, where she spent the rest of her life calmly away from the fires of war.

In 1936, she came back to Japan at last, and she was engaged in performing "Madama Butterfly" at Kabuki-za Theater, but after the musical activities were banned because World War II broke out soon, she moved with her mother to the neighborhood of Lake Yamanaka, where she spent the rest of her life calmly away from the fires of war.

In 1936, she came back to Japan at last, and she was engaged in performing "Madama Butterfly" at Kabuki-za Theater, but after the musical activities were banned because World War II broke out soon, she moved with her mother to the neighborhood of Lake Yamanaka, where she spent the rest of her life calmly away from the fires of war.

sen.j: 作曲者自身から激賞されたように「蝶々さん」が当たり役であり、その正統的で模範的な演技で評価された。
sen.e: As the composer himself praised very highly, 'Cio-Cio-San' was the role for which she gained a reputation, and she was regarded highly for her orthodox and exemplary performance.
As the composer himself praised very highly, 'Cho-Cho-San' was the role for which she gained a reputation, and she was regarded highly for her orthodox and exemplary performance.
As the composer himself praised very highly, 'Cho-Cho-San' was the role for which she gained a reputation, and she was regarded highly for her orthodox and exemplary performance.

sen.j: 少女時代に日舞を学んでいたこともあり、美しく自然な所作によって成功を掴むことができたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that she was able to gain the success by means of her beautiful and natural carriage, which she might have mastered partly because she learned Classical Japanese dance in her girlhood.
It is said that she was able to gain the success by means of her beautiful and natural carriage, which she might have mastered partly because she learned Classical Japanese dance in her girlhood.
It is said that she was able to gain the success by means of her beautiful and natural carriage, which she might have mastered partly because she learned Classical Japanese dance in her girlhood.

sen.j: その名声ゆえに、エンリコ・カルーソーやヤン・パデレフスキといったスター芸術家とも共演する機会に恵まれた。
sen.e: Thanks to her fame, she had great opportunities to perform with the star artists like Enrico Caruso and Jan Paderewski.
Thanks to her fame, she had great opportunities to perform with the star artists like Enrico Caruso and Jan Paderewski.
Thanks to her fame, she had great opportunities to perform with the star artists like Enrico Caruso and Jan Paderewski.

sen.j: 声質は様々に言い伝えられており、「どこかか細く頼りなかった」とするものや、「どちらかといえば声量は少なかったが透明感があった」とするものがある。
sen.e: About the quality of her voice, various opinions have been handed down, such as "her voice had something feeble and unreliable" and "her voice was rather weak in loudness."
About the quality of her voice, various opinions have been handed down, such as 'her voice had something feeble and unreliable' and 'her voice was rather weak in loudness.'
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオートの変更をしました。
sen.e: About the quality of her voice, various opinions have been handed down, such as 'her voice had something feeble and unreliable' and 'her voice was rather weak in loudness.'

sen.j: また声楽家の藍川由美は自著『「演歌」のススメ』の中でレコード録音された三浦の演奏を聴いて「歌詞の発音や発声法、音程、リズムなど、どれをとってもけっして褒められたものではない」と評し、日本人のなかにある「三浦環 世界のプリマ伝説」に対し疑問を呈している。
sen.e: Besides, in her own book "'Enka' no Susume" (Recommendation of 'Japanese ballad'), a vocal musician Yumi AIKAWA says "any of the pronunciation of the lyrics, the vocalization, the musical interval, the rhythm, and so on is never praiseworthy" as an evaluation after she listened to the records of MIURA's performance, and presents a question as to "the legend that Tamaki MIURA was a prima donna of the world" which many Japanese have cherished.

Besides, in her own book "'Enka' no Susume" (Recommendation of 'Japanese ballad'), a vocal musician Yumi AIKAWA says 'any of the pronunciation of the lyrics, the vocalization, the musical interval, the rhythm, and so on is never praiseworthy' as an evaluation after she listened to the records of MIURA's performance, and presents a question as to 'the legend that Tamaki MIURA was a prima donna of the world' which many Japanese have cherished.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオートの変更をしました。
sen.e: Besides, in her own book "'Enka' no Susume" (Recommendation of 'Japanese ballad'), a vocal musician Yumi AIKAWA says 'any of the pronunciation of the lyrics, the vocalization, the musical interval, the rhythm, and so on is never praiseworthy' as an evaluation after she listened to the records of MIURA's performance, and presents a question as to 'the legend that Tamaki MIURA was a prima donna of the world' which many Japanese have cherished.

sen.j: 著名な門弟に原信子、関屋敏子がいる。
sen.e: Among MIURA's famous disciples are Nobuko HARA and Toshiko SEKIYA.
Among MIURA's famous disciples are Nobuko HARA and Toshiko SEKIYA.
Among MIURA's famous disciples are Nobuko HARA and Toshiko SEKIYA.
